newsitem.title: UK: Stagecoach jumps after meeting OPRAF target.
newsitem.headline: Stagecoach jumps after meeting OPRAF target.

text.p: Shares in Stagecoach Holdings Plc jumped on Thursday after UK regulators said one of the company's rail franchises had met its performance target in April and that it would be be spared a hefty fine.
By 0847 GMT, Stagecoach shares were up 15-1/2p to 614-1/2.

Britain's Office of Passenger Rail (OPRAF) said that while Stagecoach's South West Trains of the UK would remain under scrutiny, Stagecoach would not be fined one million pounds, which it would have had to pay if it had failed to meet the target nFLLU583WG.

Stagecoach shares have been falling since late January, when they reached a peak of 804p, and last week slipped to their lowest point since November amid concerns about a fine, dealers said. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
